PEPA POCH

August 5 to October 27

2024

Collective exhibition

“ENTRE OBRAS”

(Between works)

Prefigured dialogues

with the Carmen Thyssen collección.

Sculpture / Installation / Ceramic.

24 internacional artists:

Eduardo Chillida, Jaume Plensa,

Xavier Corberó, Manolo Valdés,

Manel Álvarez, Cristina Iglesias…

“Aboriginal Land.

From what past is the future?”

GIRONA

June-October

2018

Solo exhibition.

Pepa Poch shares her experience

of transfiguring everyday elements

in works of art.

She invites to look and inhabit

the spaces poetically.

Transgress conventional concepts

endowing them with poetry,

the canvases are released from the frame,

the paintings dialogue with each other,

the wings of dreams rest on the chairs

and the porcelains play to be sculpture.

“Atelier” the space in which Pepa Poch

makes the unimaginable tangible.

"Atelier PEPA POCH"

MONASTERY MUSEUM

ESPAI CARMEN THYSSEN

Sant Feliu de Guíxols

Pepa Poch is part of the cultural project

and backed by 33 social organizations of the

"Xarxa d'Atenció a les persones Sense Llar"

(Network of Care for Homeless People),

the “Fundació Arrels”

(Roots Foundation)

and the Barcelona City Hall.

2000

Solo exhibition

Espacio Future

BARCELONA

1999

Pepa Poch is appointed

one of only fifteen members

of the London-based

International Colour Authority (I.C.A.),

a company which forecasts colour trends

for the whole world.

From then on the colours in her paintings

have been selected to set trends

for colours worldwide.

Her works illustrate trends catalogues,

and covers of the magazine “Interiors”

1999

She lives in a boat

in the port of Barcelona

and goes deeper into sea themes,

and starts to create

the first canvases and sketches

for her forthcoming exhibition in Paris

1992-1998

She lives in New York.

Creates work on paper for D.World,

Fashion Avenue NY.

Paints murals and frescos

for private collections

in New York and Barcelona.

Group exhibition

Beascoa Gallery

BARCELONA

1991

She lives in Africa,

Guinea Conakry.

Learns paper and canvas technique

with natural pigments.

First sketches for murals.

1989-1991

She stays in Paris,

Lago di Como (Milan),

London,

Rome,

Portugal,

Venice.

1980

Master School

Ramon Folch.

Pierre Cardin

scholarship holder.
